Subjective.Chief Complaint (CC): Headaches and fatigue for the past couple of weeks.
Subjective.History of Present Illness (HPI): Patient reports headaches occurring in the late afternoon, lasting several hours, with constant pressure in the front. Fatigue is constant, feeling drained even after a full night's sleep. No specific triggers identified.

History.Medical history: Headaches, fatigue, skipping breakfast, increased screen time.
History.Social History: Patient works on a computer, skips breakfast, drinks coffee in the morning, and may not be drinking enough water.

Objective.Laboratory Data: CBC and thyroid function tests pending.

Differential Diagnosis.Chronic headaches: 1. Tension-type headache. 2. Computer vision syndrome. 3. Dehydration. 4. Sleep deprivation.
Differential Diagnosis.Fatigue: 1. Sleep disorders. 2. Nutritional deficiencies. 3. Underlying medical conditions.

Chronic headaches.Therapy: Increase water intake, manage screen time, take regular breaks, stop electronic device use before bed.
Chronic headaches.Patient Education: Encourage balanced diet, hydration, regular meals, and light exercise.

Fatigue.Therapy: Improve sleep quality, manage screen time, take regular breaks, stop electronic device use before bed, incorporate light exercise.
Fatigue.Patient Education: Encourage balanced diet, hydration, regular meals, and light exercise.
